intro: Eriolobus trilobatus, commonly known as the three-lobed eriolobus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
